document.docAuthor: Vasanth, M., Selvakumar, C., Subramanian, K. A., Sivaramakrishnan, K. G. & Sinha, Bikramjit
document.docTitle: Notacanthurus pange Vasanth, Selvakumar & Subramanian 2020, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Notacanthurus Tshernova, 1974 (Ephemeroptera: Heptageniidae) from India

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Notacanthurus Tshernova, 1974 (Ephemeroptera: Heptageniidae) from India

: Ƌ larva, INDIA , Arunachal Pradesh , Lower Subansiri district ,

Wildlife Sanctuary
, Pange , 27.5485 N , 93.89756 E ,
1851 m
,
18.vi.2017
, colls. K. A. Subramanian & M. Vasanth (I/E- 440)
.

: 2 larvae , same data as holotype (I/E-441)
;

1662 m

3856 m
,
18.ix.2018
, coll. K. A. Subramanian (I/E-444)
;

1079 m
,
12.iii.2016
, coll. E. Eyarin Jehamalar.
Description. Mature male larva: Body length 7.8 mm , length of caudal filaments 8.6 mm ( Figs 1–2 ).

Genitals: Protopenis ( Fig. 19 ) male genitalia with simple, penis lobes fused, V shaped apically blunt with median pair of spine-like titillators subapically and mesally. Cerci about 1.2x length of body, each segment with whorls of minute bristles and without interfacing setae.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–5. Larva of
Notacanthurus pange
sp. nov.
1. Dorsal view; 2. Lateral view; 2A. Close up of terga V –VII; 3. Abdominal segment V; 4. Labrum; 5. Hypopharynx.

FIGURES 6–13 . Larva of
Notacanthurus pange
sp. nov.
6. Left mandible; 7. Right mandible; 8. Maxilla; 9. Labium; 10. Foreleg; 11. Scattered stout setae on the dorsal surface of fore femora; 12. Midleg; 13. Hindleg.

FIGURES 14–19. Larva of
Notacanthurus pange
sp. nov.
14. Claw; 15.Gill I. 16. Gill III; 17. Gill V; 18. Gill VI; 19. Abdominal sterna X of a male larva in ventral view (Arrow mark- ‘V’ shaped blunt titillators)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Notacanthurus pange
sp. nov.
can be accommodated in the recent global larval key to the species of
Notacanthurus
by Zhang et al. (2020) . The second part of the 5 th couplet of that key can be modified and a new couplet should be added to include
Notacanthurus pange
sp. nov.
as follows:

5. Abdominal terga with oblique stripes...................................................................... 7 - Abdominal terga without distinct markings................................................................. 6 6. Dorsal surface of femora with apically blunt scattered stout setae..................................
N. pange
sp. nov.
- Dorsal surface of femora with apically pointed stout setae..............................................
N. baekdu
Etymology: The species named after the type locality, Pange, Lower Subansiri district, Arunachal Pradesh state , India .
Distribution: India ( Arunachal Pradesh , Meghalaya and Sikkim ) ( Fig. 21 ).
